snippet: The subject of a meeting of astrophysicists is a new baby picture — and all of its vital statistics — of the universe when it was 380,000 years old and space was as hot as the surface of the sun.
abstract: Astronomers gather at Palazzo Costabili in Ferrara, Italy, for Planck 2014 meeting to discuss European Space Agency's portrait of universe when it was 380,000 years old; agency's Planck satellite spent three years surveying haze of microwave radiation left over from last moments of Big Bang, and will publish data in journal Astronomy & Astrophysics.
lead_paragraph: The subject of a meeting of astrophysicists is a new baby picture — and all of its vital statistics — of the universe when it was 380,000 years old and space was as hot as the surface of the sun.

headline.main: New Images Refine View of Infant Universe
headline.print_headline: New Images Refine View of Infant Universe
